alert.note: Alert for Dyer; Gibson; Obion (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 8:44PM CST until January 12 at 9:36PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee... Obion River near Obion For the Obion River...including Martin, Obion, Bogota...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Obion River near Obion. * WHEN...From Monday evening to late Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Several secondary roads and large areas of farmland are flooded in northern Dyer County. Flooding is occurring around Rives in southeast Obion County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CST Sunday the stage was 31.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to a crest of 35.0 feet Tuesday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 34.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
